metadata.title: CVE-2009-3603 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the SplashBitmap::SplashBitmap function in Xpdf 3.xbefore 3.02pl4 and Poppler before 0.12.1 might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF document that triggers aheap-based buffer overflow. NOTE: some of these details are obtained fromthird party information. NOTE: this issue reportedly exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2009-1188.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3603` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
libpoppler68 - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
poppler package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.2-2.1ubuntu1').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
